compound.name: EnviroDIYPublisher
compound.brief: The EnviroDIYPublisher subclass of dataPublisher for publishing data to the Monitor My Watershed/EnviroDIY data portal at https://monitormywatershed.org/ (formerly at http://data.enviroDIY.org).

base_classes.name: dataPublisher
base_classes.brief: The dataPublisher class is a virtual class used by other publishers to distribute data online.

typeless_funcs.name: EnviroDIYPublisher
typeless_funcs.brief: Construct a new EnviroDIY Publisher object with no members set.

typeless_funcs.name: EnviroDIYPublisher
typeless_funcs.brief: Construct a new EnviroDIY Publisher object.
typeless_funcs.description:
Note

If a client is never specified, the publisher will attempt to create and use a client on a LoggerModem instance tied to the attached logger.

params.name: baseLogger
params.description: The logger supplying the data to be published

params.name: sendEveryX
params.description: Interval (in units of the logging interval) between attempted data transmissions.

typeless_funcs.name: EnviroDIYPublisher
typeless_funcs.brief: Construct a new EnviroDIY Publisher object.

params.name: baseLogger
params.description: The logger supplying the data to be published

params.name: inClient
params.description: An Arduino client instance to use to print data to. Allows the use of any type of client and multiple clients tied to a single TinyGSM modem instance

params.name: sendEveryX
params.description: Interval (in units of the logging interval) between attempted data transmissions.

typeless_funcs.name: EnviroDIYPublisher
typeless_funcs.brief: Construct a new EnviroDIY Publisher object.

params.name: baseLogger
params.description: The logger supplying the data to be published

params.name: registrationToken
params.description: The registration token for the site on the Monitor My Watershed data portal.

params.name: samplingFeatureUUID
params.description: The sampling feature UUID for the site on the Monitor My Watershed data portal.

params.name: sendEveryX
params.description: Interval (in units of the logging interval) between attempted data transmissions.

params.name: inClient

public_funcs.name: getEndpoint
public_funcs.brief: Get the destination for published data - generally the host name of the data receiver.
public_funcs.return_value: The URL or HOST to receive published data

public_funcs.name: getHost
public_funcs.brief: Get the EnviroDIY/Monitor My Watershed web host.
public_funcs.return_value: The EnviroDIY/Monitor My Watershed web host

public_funcs.name: setHost
public_funcs.brief: Set the EnviroDIY/Monitor My Watershed web host.

params.name: host
params.description: The EnviroDIY/Monitor My Watershed web host

public_funcs.name: getPath
public_funcs.brief: Get the EnviroDIY/Monitor My Watershed API path.
public_funcs.return_value: The EnviroDIY/Monitor My Watershed API path

public_funcs.name: setPath
public_funcs.brief: Set the EnviroDIY/Monitor My Watershed API path.

params.name: endpoint
params.description: The EnviroDIY/Monitor My Watershed API path

public_funcs.name: getPort
public_funcs.brief: Get the EnviroDIY/Monitor My Watershed API port.
public_funcs.return_value: The EnviroDIY/Monitor My Watershed API port

public_funcs.name: setPort
public_funcs.brief: Set the EnviroDIY/Monitor My Watershed API port.

params.name: port
params.description: The EnviroDIY/Monitor My Watershed API port

params.name: registrationToken
params.description: The registration token for the site on the Monitor My Watershed data portal.

public_funcs.name: calculateJsonSize
public_funcs.brief: Calculates how long the outgoing JSON will be.
public_funcs.return_value: The number of characters in the JSON object.

public_funcs.name: begin
public_funcs.brief: Begin the publisher - linking it to the client and logger.
public_funcs.description: This can be used as an alternative to adding the logger and client in the constructor.

params.name: baseLogger
params.description: The logger supplying the data to be published

params.name: inClient
params.description: An Arduino client instance to use to print data to. Allows the use of any type of client and multiple clients tied to a single TinyGSM modem instance

params.name: registrationToken
params.description: The registration token for the site on the Monitor My Watershed data portal.

params.name: samplingFeatureUUID
params.description: The sampling feature UUID for the site on the Monitor My Watershed data portal.

public_funcs.name: begin
public_funcs.brief: Begin the publisher - linking it to the logger but not attaching a client.
public_funcs.description:
Note

If a client is never specified, the publisher will attempt to create and use a client on a LoggerModem instance tied to the attached logger.

This can be used as an alternative to adding the logger and client in the constructor.

params.name: baseLogger
params.description: The logger supplying the data to be published

params.name: registrationToken
params.description: The registration token for the site on the Monitor My Watershed data portal.

params.name: samplingFeatureUUID
params.description: The sampling feature UUID for the site on the Monitor My Watershed data portal.

public_funcs.name: begin
public_funcs.brief: Begin the publisher - linking it to the logger but not attaching a client.
public_funcs.description:
Note

If a client is never specified, the publisher will attempt to create and use a client on a LoggerModem instance tied to the attached logger.

This can be used as an alternative to adding the logger and client in the constructor.

params.name: baseLogger
params.description: The logger supplying the data to be published

params.name: registrationToken
params.description: The registration token for the site on the Monitor My Watershed data portal.

public_funcs.name: connectionNeeded
public_funcs.brief: Checks if the publisher needs an Internet connection for the next publishData call (as opposed to just buffering data internally).
public_funcs.return_value: True if an internet connection is needed for the next publish.

public_funcs.name: publishData
public_funcs.brief: Utilize an attached modem to open a a TCP connection to the EnviroDIY/ODM2DataSharingPortal and then stream out a post request over that connection.
public_funcs.description: This depends on an internet connection already having been made and a client being available.
public_funcs.return_value: The http status code of the response.

params.name: outClient
params.description: An Arduino client instance to use to print data to. Allows the use of any type of client and multiple clients tied to a single TinyGSM modem instance

params.name: forceFlush
params.description: Ask the publisher to flush buffered data immediately.

protected_funcs.name: flushDataBuffer
protected_funcs.brief: Transmit data from the data buffer to an external site.
protected_funcs.description:
Note

A 504 will be returned automatically if the server does not respond within 30 seconds.
protected_funcs.return_value: The HTTP response code from the publish attempt

params.name: outClient
params.description: The client to publish the data over

protected_vars.name: _logBuffer
protected_vars.brief: Internal reference to the logger buffer.

protected_vars.name: _initialTransmissionsRemaining
protected_vars.brief: The number of transmissions remaining at the single minute intervals.
protected_vars.description:
We send every one of the first five data points at only one minute intervals for faster in-field validation.

Todo

This should be a user-settable parameter.

groups.name: Portions of the POST request to EnviroDIY
Portions of the JSON object for EnviroDIY
